blog.name: thelastdragon6
blog.title: Starkwalker
blog.description:
HERE TO HAVE A GOOD TIME

<a href=“https://thelastdragon6.tumblr.com/post/183831557809/master-list”>Masterlist.</a>

body:
Found Legacy Ch.1

A/N- this is the sequel to ‘Lost legacy’! This is going to follow after the last book left off and following the events of endgame. (remember it’s a rewrite of sorts and also my own story ) Everything in this font is her thoughts.

Warning- Spoilers, angst

—

It’s quiet no sound can be heard in the ship. The whole way back home is quiet. If you listen close enough it’s like you could hear each other’s breathing. Occasional sniffles is also heard but nobody says anything about it. We all feel a void in ourselves. We feel like failures. We didn’t stop the enemy from space. We should’ve stopped him, we should’ve tried harder. Now half of the people are gone and we don’t who those people were.

I try to text Tony one more time but he doesn’t answer. I call him multiple times but theirs no answer.

C’mon dad where are you.

I text and call all of my friends but none of them answer. I text Harry and he answers with a simple ‘here’. I call him and he answers on the first ring.

‘Hey. Hey you’re here. Oh god.’ I tell him through the phone a sigh of relief escaping my lips.

‘Alexandria are you okay? What’s going on?’ He sounded frantic.

‘It’s-its I- can I explain later? Are you home?’

‘Im here.. can you come over? when you can please.’

‘I will I’ll see you.’

‘See ya.’

And like that the phone went silent. I tried calling my dad one more time but nothing no answer. I tried calling Peter but also no answer. I throw my phone on the ground and I could see that I scared a couple of people that were lost in their own thoughts.

“I’m sorry.” I mumble. I rest my head in my hands and sigh. I feel frustrated with the lack of answers I’m getting from my dad Tony and Peter.

hopefully they’re both still alive.

-

I knocked on the door a couple of times. I was nervous that Harry was not going to answer even if he did tell me he was here.

When I made my way here even if I did fly to get here I still saw the destruction of what had happened. Cars wrecked or inside of buildings. Things all over the place. The normal sound of car horns or police was not heard. It was all quiet in the city. Something not common at all. Made me feel even worse then I already felt.

The door was thrown open. I immediatly felt a feeling of joy and relief. My eyes got watery as I wide grin spread across my face when I saw him on the other side. He returned the smile and I nearly jumped on him on to hug him. He tightened the embrace and he ran his hands through my hair.

“I’m so glad you’re here.” I mumbled to him. We broke apart from the hug and he gave me a gentle kiss. He broke apart and I could see the sadness in his eyes. His eyes were puffy and red from crying. He pulled me into another tight embrace. It felt like he was holding on to me just to make sure I was actually here.

“My dad he-he’s gone I saw him and then he just-he just turned to dust. Bernard he also he just he also turned to dust.” He said his voice breaking into a sob. It broke my heart to hear him like this. I hugged him tighter. I felt tears myself go down my cheeks. He lost everything. He lost his family he doesn’t have anyone else. And it broke my heart that I couldn’t try harder to stop Thanos. I should’ve tried harder.

“I’m so sorry, I’m sorry.” I kept telling him.

I should’ve tried harder.

-

It’s been a couple days after we returned back from Wakanda. I felt desperation , anxious, I felt tired and sadness. My dad was still gone in space along with Peter. Their hasn’t been any sign of them. I tried and tried. I couldn’t find a way to commiuncate with them. I would get barely any hours of sleep as I tried hard to get them back or at least talk to them. I had hope they were still out there that they were still alive. I needed to hang onto that hope or else I don’t know what I would do.

“Hey kiddo.” Even if I wasn’t looking I knew who was talking. It was Steve. Lately he has been checking on me. He was trying to help me. I knew what he thought about my dad. But I couldn’t let myself think that.

“What’s up?” I said as I turned my head to see him leaning by the door.

“Brought food Harry says you haven’t ate yet.” He then walks to where I’m sitting and sets the plate down next to me. Lately I’ve lacked on eating food. Finding barely any appetite for it. But the Steve, Natahsa, Pepper, Rhodey and Harry would always insist. Harry was staying at the compound with me. He didn’t want to stay home alone so I brought him with me. I would often sleep at the compound. I felt like time would pass by quickly before I would know I would wake up in my old room. I hated leaving Pepper alone but I couldn’t make it home.

I took a bite of the food just so Steve wouldn’t say anything.

“What are you doing here?” He asked as he took a seat next me. I looked back at the screen.

“Looks like my dad had a suit built for me he just had it under his ‘emergency’ file. Just making a few adjustments for it to be good to go into space.” I told him while I took another bite of the food not tearing my eyes away from my work. He stayed quiet but I knew he was holding back on something he wanted to say. “Spit out already I know you want to say something.” I said to him.

“Alexandria I know you love your dad and you want him back but what if he’s gone like the others—-”

“You said “what if” I’m holding on to that what if.” I inturrpeted him. He sighed.

“We’re all trying hard to understand what Thanos did and how to get those that disappeared back…. if your dad was still out there don’t you think he would’ve communicated to us or came back?” He asked. I knew he was trying to help me out and looking out for me but I still can’t help but feel the anger rise inside me.

“And what if he didn’t disappear?” I snapped at him. “What if he’s lost or stuck somewhere? Huh? I can’t leave him out there.” I felt my eyes sting from the angry tears that threatened to fall. I felt a breeze in the room, one that was once not here.

“You can’t lose yourself along the way…. if he’s gone then you’ll just get lost yourself trying to find him.” I felt the breeze pick up and the anger I felt just increase. The ground was shaking and I could feel the fire in my fingerstips.

“He’s not gone! Why are you convinced that he is!” I yelled. The wind I was causing was getting worse it was sending lose papers all over the place and my hair rise. Dirt and rocks would hit the windows. The rain that was dropping lightly before now was harder and the droplets would hit the window too. I could feel the ground shake harder and the fire that was in my fingertips now increased and wrapped around my clenched fist. I was losing control I could feel it. I was losing control of my powers.

“you have to calm down Alexandria please.” I could hear the panic in his voice and I could see his eyes shift from the window to me. Natasha and Carol a girl that came from space after we found a beeper that belonged to Nick fury beeped her to come to earth. She was helping us and staying here while she helped us out. They both rushed inside the room a worried expression on their faces.

“He’s not gone.” I sobbed while I fell on my knees. The window that I was causing outside broke the windows. The ground wasn’t shaking anymore and the fire that was surrounding my fists was gone and the rain outside turned back to light rain. Steve didn’t hesitate to fall next to me and hug me trying to comfort me. I hadn’t let myself cry or feel anything after we got back I couldn’t.

I know Tony is out there. I know my dad is out there. And I’m going to do whatever it takes to get him back.

.

.

.

.

.

I should’ve tried harder.

-

It’s been a couple days after we returned back from Wakanda. I felt desperation , anxious, I felt tired and sadness. My dad was still gone in space along with Peter. Their hasn’t been any sign of them. I tried and tried. I couldn’t find a way to commiuncate with them. I would get barely any hours of sleep as I tried hard to get them back or at least talk to them. I had hope they were still out there that they were still alive. I needed to hang onto that hope or else I don’t know what I would do.

“Hey kiddo.” Even if I wasn’t looking I knew who was talking. It was Steve. Lately he has been checking on me. He was trying to help me. I knew what he thought about my dad. But I couldn’t let myself think that.

“What’s up?” I said as I turned my head to see him leaning by the door.

“Brought food Harry says you haven’t ate yet.” He then walks to where I’m sitting and sets the plate down next to me. Lately I’ve lacked on eating food. Finding barely any appetite for it. But the Steve, Natahsa, Pepper, Rhodey and Harry would always insist. Harry was staying at the compound with me. He didn’t want to stay home alone so I brought him with me. I would often sleep at the compound. I felt like time would pass by quickly before I would know I would wake up in my old room. I hated leaving Pepper alone but I couldn’t make it home.

I took a bite of the food just so Steve wouldn’t say anything.

“What are you doing here?” He asked as he took a seat next me. I looked back at the screen.

“Looks like my dad had a suit built for me he just had it under his ‘emergency’ file. Just making a few adjustments for it to be good to go into space.” I told him while I took another bite of the food not tearing my eyes away from my work. He stayed quiet but I knew he was holding back on something he wanted to say. “Spit out already I know you want to say something.” I said to him.

“Alexandria I know you love your dad and you want him back but what if he’s gone like the others—-”

“You said “what if” I’m holding on to that what if.” I inturrpeted him. He sighed.

“We’re all trying hard to understand what Thanos did and how to get those that disappeared back…. if your dad was still out there don’t you think he would’ve communicated to us or came back?” He asked. I knew he was trying to help me out and looking out for me but I still can’t help but feel the anger rise inside me.

“And what if he didn’t disappear?” I snapped at him. “What if he’s lost or stuck somewhere? Huh? I can’t leave him out there.” I felt my eyes sting from the angry tears that threatened to fall. I felt a breeze in the room, one that was once not here.

“You can’t lose yourself along the way…. if he’s gone then you’ll just get lost yourself trying to find him.” I felt the breeze pick up and the anger I felt just increase. The ground was shaking and I could feel the fire in my fingerstips.

“He’s not gone! Why are you convinced that he is!” I yelled. The wind I was causing was getting worse it was sending lose papers all over the place and my hair rise. Dirt and rocks would hit the windows. The rain that was dropping lightly before now was harder and the droplets would hit the window too. I could feel the ground shake harder and the fire that was in my fingertips now increased and wrapped around my clenched fist. I was losing control I could feel it. I was losing control of my powers.

“you have to calm down Alexandria please.” I could hear the panic in his voice and I could see his eyes shift from the window to me. Natasha and Carol a girl that came from space after we found a beeper that belonged to Nick fury beeped her to come to earth. She was helping us and staying here while she helped us out. They both rushed inside the room a worried expression on their faces.

“He’s not gone.” I sobbed while I fell on my knees. The window that I was causing outside broke the windows. The ground wasn’t shaking anymore and the fire that was surrounding my fists was gone and the rain outside turned back to light rain. Steve didn’t hesitate to fall next to me and hug me trying to comfort me. I hadn’t let myself cry or feel anything after we got back I couldn’t.

I know Tony is out there. I know my dad is out there. And I’m going to do whatever it takes to get him back.

.

.

.

.

.

We should’ve stopped him, we should’ve tried harder. Now half of the people are gone and we don’t who those people were.

I try to text Tony one more time but he doesn’t answer. I call him multiple times but theirs no answer.

C’mon dad where are you.

I text and call all of my friends but none of them answer. I text Harry and he answers with a simple ‘here’. I call him and he answers on the first ring.

‘Hey. Hey you’re here. Oh god.’ I tell him through the phone a sigh of relief escaping my lips.

‘Alexandria are you okay? What’s going on?’ He sounded frantic.

‘It’s-its I- can I explain later? Are you home?’

‘Im here.. can you come over? when you can please.’

‘I will I’ll see you.’

‘See ya.’

And like that the phone went silent. I tried calling my dad one more time but nothing no answer. I tried calling Peter but also no answer. I throw my phone on the ground and I could see that I scared a couple of people that were lost in their own thoughts.

“I’m sorry.” I mumble. I rest my head in my hands and sigh. I feel frustrated with the lack of answers I’m getting from my dad Tony and Peter.

hopefully they’re both still alive.

I should’ve tried harder.

blog.description: Welcome to the workshop of genius, futurist Tony Stark! Stop on by and admire this Avenger in all of his fabulous forms!

summary: I teach kindergarten and several kids keep cutting out blue circles and gluing them to their hands and chest, then fly around...
body:
I teach kindergarten and several kids keep cutting out blue circles and gluing them to their hands and chest, then fly around the room claiming to be Iron Man.

On one hand I need to scold them for gluing themselves but on the other hand…they are pretending to be Tony. 😂

title: A New Beginning
body:
Notes: So, this is a bit different from my usual! This is not a reader insert and is just my take on Peter meeting Morgan for the first time. As always, my asks/DMs/submit box/tag list is always open so feel free to drop in anytime. 

Summary: Peter meets Morgan for the first time.

A New Beginning

Requested?: Yes, @missjockey101 : “Peter meeting Morgan properly?”

Word Count: 1,238

Warnings: ENDGAME SPOILERS!! so don’t read if u haven’t watched it. Also, it’s very fluffy with a bit of angst sprinkled in.

There’s a knock on the door.

“I’ll get it, Aunt May.” Peter opens up the door, a quizzical expression on his face.

“Peter Parker.” Pepper smiles sadly.

“Oh– Peter, who is this?” May walks in, smiling at the new stranger at the door.

“Hi, I’m Pepper. I…was Tony’s wife. I’m here to talk to Peter and to formally invite the two of you to Tony’s…um, Tony’s funeral.” Pepper stumbles on the last word, not wanting to bring light to the tragedy that plagued them not too long ago.

“Right. Come on in, do you want some coffee?” May gestures for Peter to open the door to let Pepper in.

“That would be great, thanks.” Pepper sits down on the couch. Peter quietly sits across from her, playing with his fingers in his lap.

“So…is the funeral the only reason you came?” He strains, trying to keep from crying again. He had shed so many tears on the man already, and he wanted to stay strong in front of his widowed wife.

“No, actually. I came here because you and Tony were very close. After the snap, he told me that you were the son he never had. He was truly devastated, and you were the main reason he tried to reverse the events of the snap. He wanted you back, Peter Parker. So, that being said…I needed to let you know that you have a sister.” The corners of Pepper’s mouth slightly turn up. Peter’s head shoots up, shock covering his face.

“I-I have a sister? Where is she– can I see her?” He breathes out quickly, standing up and grabbing his coat. May walks in with three cups of coffee and sits down.

“What’s going on?” May looks lost.

“If it’s alright with you, Ms. Parker, I’d like to take Peter to the Avengers Compound to meet Tony and I’s daughter.” Pepper takes a cup of coffee and quickly downs the entire thing. She’s quite tired, after all.

“Yeah, that’s absolutely fine. Tell me when you’re on your way home, okay, Pete?” May smiles and ruffles Peter’s hair, setting the cup of coffee in his hand. He smiles widely and hugs May, thankful for everything she’s done since he got back.

“Thank you.” He whispers and lets go of her, running out of the door as Pepper follows behind.

“We’ll be back in a bit.” Pepper smiles and closes the door behind her.


Pulling up to the Avengers Compound, Peter is beyond jittery.

“Will she like me?” He asks suddenly, worry etching into his features.

“She’ll love you, Peter. I know it.” Pepper sets a calming hand onto his shoulder. He slowly calms down.

“We’re here.” Happy turns around and gives the two of them a small smile.

“Thanks, Happy.” Pepper and Peter say in unison. As soon as the car stops, Peter jumps out and runs to the door.

“Peter!” Shuri rushes to Peter and hugs him tightly.

“Shuri!” Peter grins, hugging her back. The two teens pull away and give each other sad but reassuring smiles.

“Hey, Shuri, do you know where Morgan is? Peter is here to see her.” Pepper walks up to the two of them.

“She’s in the living room area, watching some TV.” Shuri smiles and wishes the two well before walking back to her brother, punching him lightly in the arm.

Pepper leads Peter to the living room area. He stops as soon as he sees the small figure on the couch looking up at a large TV screen. Pepper stops next to him, giving him a small glance.

“Mommy?” Morgan turns around upon hearing the footsteps, seeing her mom and a random boy. She ducks behind the couch cushion when she sees Peter, only shyly peeking her eyes above the cushion after a few seconds.

“Hey, Morgan. This is your big brother.” Pepper introduces Peter to the young girl.

“Hi, I’m Peter.” He can’t help but let a few tears roll down his cheeks as he smiles at her. She’s a striking image of Tony.

“How come I didn’t see you before?” Morgan looks at Peter with skepticism and curiosity.

“He was one of the people that got erased before daddy defeated the bad guy. Remember, I told you about them?” Pepper explains.

“Oh. Yeah.” Morgan nods her head slowly, coming up from behind the couch cushion fully.

“I’ll leave you two to talk for a little bit.” Pepper smiles and leaves the room. Peter slowly walks to the couch and sits down next to Morgan.

“So you’re my big brother?” She tilts her head to the side, eyes shining with intelligence.

She’s definitely Tony’s daughter, Peter thinks.

“Yeah, yeah I am.” He smiles. In the blink of an eye, Morgan is hugging Peter tightly.

“I’ve never had a big brother before!” She laughs, finally showing a smile. Peter smiles back, one of the first smiles he’s shown that hasn’t been out of sadness.

“Well, I’m here now.” He ruffles her hair slightly as she pulls away from the hug.

“Do you want to watch TV with me?” She gasps, handing him the remote. He nods.

“I’d love to.” He browses the channels with Morgan as the two continue to talk. And for once since Tony’s death, he’s found peace.


“Pepper?” Peter asks on the way back to his apartment.

“Yes?” She hums, looking up from her screen to look Peter in the eyes. He glances down slightly to see that she was looking at an old photo of her, Tony, and Morgan together.

“Why did you introduce me to Morgan as her big brother when I’m not?” He asks.

“Because she just lost her father and she needs a big brother to look up to now. Plus, as she grows up she’ll realize that you’re not related by blood but by relation and it won’t make a difference after she’s grown up with you. plus…I was hoping that, if it’s okay with May, the two of you could stay here, in the compound, with the rest of us? We could use Spider-Man around here.” Pepper proposes, raising an eyebrow.

“If May says yes, then I’m in.”


Five years later


“Peter!” Morgan launches herself onto her big brother. By this point, she knew he wasn’t actually her big brother, but she didn’t care. He pretty much was.

“Hey, Morgan. Have you seen May?” Peter laughs and twirls her around.

“She’s in her room. I set up heroes for us to play whenever you’re ready, though.” Morgan grins as Peter sets her down on the ground.

“Yeah, of course, I’ll be there in a second.” Peter ruffles her hair and she runs to her room to wait to play with Peter.

“Peter?” May rounds the corner, a smile playing on her lips.

“Hey, Aunt May.” Peter hugs her.

“How was the mission?”

“Good. Tiring, but good. Shuri completely disoriented the guy by the time I could get him with my webs.” 

“I’m glad you’re back safe. Pepper is making dinner as a good job for the team, so I’ll call you and Morgan down when you’re ready.”

“Thanks, May.” Peter starts to walk toward Morgan’s room.

“Oh, and Peter?” May calls out. Peter turns around.

“Yeah?”

“Tony would be proud of you.”

“Thank you.” A soft smile appears on Peter’s face. Things are okay now, and they’re going to stay okay as long as Peter has any say in it.

Warnings: ENDGAME SPOILERS!! so don’t read if u haven’t watched it. Also, it’s very fluffy with a bit of angst sprinkled in.

[[MORE]]

There’s a knock on the door.

“I’ll get it, Aunt May.” Peter opens up the door, a quizzical expression on his face.

“Peter Parker.” Pepper smiles sadly.

“Oh– Peter, who is this?” May walks in, smiling at the new stranger at the door.

“Hi, I’m Pepper. I…was Tony’s wife. I’m here to talk to Peter and to formally invite the two of you to Tony’s…um, Tony’s funeral.” Pepper stumbles on the last word, not wanting to bring light to the tragedy that plagued them not too long ago.

“Right. Come on in, do you want some coffee?” May gestures for Peter to open the door to let Pepper in.

“That would be great, thanks.” Pepper sits down on the couch. Peter quietly sits across from her, playing with his fingers in his lap.

“So…is the funeral the only reason you came?” He strains, trying to keep from crying again. He had shed so many tears on the man already, and he wanted to stay strong in front of his widowed wife.

“No, actually. I came here because you and Tony were very close. After the snap, he told me that you were the son he never had. He was truly devastated, and you were the main reason he tried to reverse the events of the snap. He wanted you back, Peter Parker. So, that being said…I needed to let you know that you have a sister.” The corners of Pepper’s mouth slightly turn up. Peter’s head shoots up, shock covering his face.

“I-I have a sister? Where is she– can I see her?” He breathes out quickly, standing up and grabbing his coat. May walks in with three cups of coffee and sits down.

“What’s going on?” May looks lost.

“If it’s alright with you, Ms. Parker, I’d like to take Peter to the Avengers Compound to meet Tony and I’s daughter.” Pepper takes a cup of coffee and quickly downs the entire thing. She’s quite tired, after all.

“Yeah, that’s absolutely fine. Tell me when you’re on your way home, okay, Pete?” May smiles and ruffles Peter’s hair, setting the cup of coffee in his hand. He smiles widely and hugs May, thankful for everything she’s done since he got back.

“Thank you.” He whispers and lets go of her, running out of the door as Pepper follows behind.

“We’ll be back in a bit.” Pepper smiles and closes the door behind her.


Pulling up to the Avengers Compound, Peter is beyond jittery.

“Will she like me?” He asks suddenly, worry etching into his features.

“She’ll love you, Peter. I know it.” Pepper sets a calming hand onto his shoulder. He slowly calms down.

“We’re here.” Happy turns around and gives the two of them a small smile.

“Thanks, Happy.” Pepper and Peter say in unison. As soon as the car stops, Peter jumps out and runs to the door.

“Peter!” Shuri rushes to Peter and hugs him tightly.

“Shuri!” Peter grins, hugging her back. The two teens pull away and give each other sad but reassuring smiles.

“Hey, Shuri, do you know where Morgan is? Peter is here to see her.” Pepper walks up to the two of them.

“She’s in the living room area, watching some TV.” Shuri smiles and wishes the two well before walking back to her brother, punching him lightly in the arm.

Pepper leads Peter to the living room area. He stops as soon as he sees the small figure on the couch looking up at a large TV screen. Pepper stops next to him, giving him a small glance.

“Mommy?” Morgan turns around upon hearing the footsteps, seeing her mom and a random boy. She ducks behind the couch cushion when she sees Peter, only shyly peeking her eyes above the cushion after a few seconds.

“Hey, Morgan. This is your big brother.” Pepper introduces Peter to the young girl.

“Hi, I’m Peter.” He can’t help but let a few tears roll down his cheeks as he smiles at her. She’s a striking image of Tony.

“How come I didn’t see you before?” Morgan looks at Peter with skepticism and curiosity.

“He was one of the people that got erased before daddy defeated the bad guy. Remember, I told you about them?” Pepper explains.

“Oh. Yeah.” Morgan nods her head slowly, coming up from behind the couch cushion fully.

“I’ll leave you two to talk for a little bit.” Pepper smiles and leaves the room. Peter slowly walks to the couch and sits down next to Morgan.

“So you’re my big brother?” She tilts her head to the side, eyes shining with intelligence.

She’s definitely Tony’s daughter, Peter thinks.

“Yeah, yeah I am.” He smiles. In the blink of an eye, Morgan is hugging Peter tightly.

“I’ve never had a big brother before!” She laughs, finally showing a smile. Peter smiles back, one of the first smiles he’s shown that hasn’t been out of sadness.

“Well, I’m here now.” He ruffles her hair slightly as she pulls away from the hug.

“Do you want to watch TV with me?” She gasps, handing him the remote. He nods.

“I’d love to.” He browses the channels with Morgan as the two continue to talk. And for once since Tony’s death, he’s found peace.


“Pepper?” Peter asks on the way back to his apartment.

“Yes?” She hums, looking up from her screen to look Peter in the eyes. He glances down slightly to see that she was looking at an old photo of her, Tony, and Morgan together.

“Why did you introduce me to Morgan as her big brother when I’m not?” He asks.

“Because she just lost her father and she needs a big brother to look up to now. Plus, as she grows up she’ll realize that you’re not related by blood but by relation and it won’t make a difference after she’s grown up with you. plus…I was hoping that, if it’s okay with May, the two of you could stay here, in the compound, with the rest of us? We could use Spider-Man around here.” Pepper proposes, raising an eyebrow.

“If May says yes, then I’m in.”


Five years later


“Peter!” Morgan launches herself onto her big brother. By this point, she knew he wasn’t actually her big brother, but she didn’t care. He pretty much was.

“Hey, Morgan. Have you seen May?” Peter laughs and twirls her around.

“She’s in her room. I set up heroes for us to play whenever you’re ready, though.” Morgan grins as Peter sets her down on the ground.

“Yeah, of course, I’ll be there in a second.” Peter ruffles her hair and she runs to her room to wait to play with Peter.

“Peter?” May rounds the corner, a smile playing on her lips.

“Hey, Aunt May.” Peter hugs her.

“How was the mission?”

“Good. Tiring, but good. Shuri completely disoriented the guy by the time I could get him with my webs.” 

“I’m glad you’re back safe. Pepper is making dinner as a good job for the team, so I’ll call you and Morgan down when you’re ready.”

“Thanks, May.” Peter starts to walk toward Morgan’s room.

“Oh, and Peter?” May calls out. Peter turns around.

“Yeah?”

“Tony would be proud of you.”

“Thank you.” A soft smile appears on Peter’s face. Things are okay now, and they’re going to stay okay as long as Peter has any say in it.
